element.name: Save The King by toczygroszek (maintained by daraconn), Unknown Cache (2.5/1.5)
element.long-description:
The coordinates above are for reference only. For the real coordinates you must solve the puzzle below:
You can check your answers for this puzzle on
Geochecker.com.
Cache location is accessible Monday - Friday 7.30 am - 7.30 pm. On some Saturdays and Sundays the grounds are open but regulations are not clear - better come there during working days.
The cache is an unusual container including a logbook and a pencil. Please, retrieve the cache with care to prevent muggles from discovering its location.
This cache will be maintained by daraconn
element.encoded-hints: Sometimes you have to give up all the pawns to win the game

ul.li:
2010-05-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by Sally&eL
17:37 #592
... took a while to solve this one, but when we did, we realized it was not that hard after all.. ... interesting place
TFTC

2010-05-20T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Asquith
Shame! I had high hopes for this one and managed to decode the coords relatively quickly. At the interesting and fitting final location, I found an unusual hide/container but couldn't see how it could contain a pencil and logbook, besides which it didn't really fit in with the general theme of the cache and I didn't have a screwdriver handy to check further. I also found a football boot hiding halfway up a tree, but the terrain attribute for this was much more than 1.5. I finally gave up after 30 minutes as I was being observed by elderly muggles on a bench 100 yards away. Thanks anyway for bringing me here, loved the location.

2010-04-05T19:00:00Z : Write note by dottigross
We solved the puzzle, but couldn't sign the logbook, because the park was closed and we were in Dublin only at the Easter holidays [V][V][V]
Thanks anyway for the puzzle.
dottigross

2010-03-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Found today with Blue Jay 59. BJ 59 had spent a few nights working out the co-ords & we were anxious to see the cache as all the previous finders had high praise for this one. We were not disappointed. TFTC. Toffee Man. #260

2010-03-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Had a look at this the other night, had one half of the solution worked out when our chess player son looked at it and made a comment and voila! there ya go! The co-ords ! Nice to get one of these [:D] TFTC & the puzzle, to creator & minder. Blue Jay 59 #260
[This entry was edited by Blue Jay 59 on Friday, March 26, 2010 at 5:10:57 PM.]

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Save The King
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The coordinates above are for reference only. For the real coordinates you must solve the puzzle below:



You can check your answers for this puzzle on Geochecker.com.

Cache location is accessible Monday - Friday 7.30 am - 7.30 pm. On some Saturdays and Sundays the grounds are open but regulations are not clear - better come there during working days.

The cache is an unusual container including a logbook and a pencil. Please, retrieve the cache with care to prevent muggles from discovering its location.



This cache will be maintained by daraconn



Additional Waypoints

... took a while to solve this one, but when we did, we realized it was not that hard after all.. ... interesting place

Shame! I had high hopes for this one and managed to decode the coords relatively quickly. At the interesting and fitting final location, I found an unusual hide/container but couldn't see how it could contain a pencil and logbook, besides which it didn't really fit in with the general theme of the cache and I didn't have a screwdriver handy to check further. I also found a football boot hiding halfway up a tree, but the terrain attribute for this was much more than 1.5. I finally gave up after 30 minutes as I was being observed by elderly muggles on a bench 100 yards away. Thanks anyway for bringing me here, loved the location.

We solved the puzzle, but couldn't sign the logbook, because the park was closed and we were in Dublin only at the Easter holidays [V][V][V]
Thanks anyway for the puzzle.
